member.summary: Asynchronous access to response headers.

member.summary: Async stream to send streaming requests.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.AsyncClientStreamingCall`2.GetAwaiter
member.summary: Allows awaiting this object directly.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.AsyncClientStreamingCall`2.GetStatus
member.summary: Gets the call status if the call has already finished. Throws InvalidOperationException otherwise.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.AsyncClientStreamingCall`2.GetTrailers
member.summary: Gets the call trailing metadata if the call has already finished. Throws InvalidOperationException otherwise.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.AsyncClientStreamingCall`2.Dispose
member.summary: Provides means to cleanup after the call. If the call has already finished normally (request stream has been completed and call result has been received), doesn't do anything. Otherwise, requests cancellation of the call which should terminate all pending async operations associated with the call. As a result, all resources being used by the call should be released eventually.
member.remarks: Normally, there is no need for you to dispose the call unless you want to utilize the "Cancel" semantics of invoking Dispose.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.AsyncDuplexStreamingCall`2.Dispose
member.summary: Provides means to cleanup after the call. If the call has already finished normally (request stream has been completed and response stream has been fully read), doesn't do anything. Otherwise, requests cancellation of the call which should terminate all pending async operations associated with the call. As a result, all resources being used by the call should be released eventually.
member.remarks: Normally, there is no need for you to dispose the call unless you want to utilize the "Cancel" semantics of invoking Dispose.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.AuthContext
member.summary: Authentication context for a call. AuthContext is the only reliable source of truth when it comes to authenticating calls. Using any other call/context properties for authentication purposes is wrong and inherently unsafe. Note: experimental API that can change or be removed without any prior notice.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.AuthContext.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Grpc.Core.AuthProperty}})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Peer identity property name.
Multimap of auth properties by name.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.AuthContext.IsPeerAuthenticated
member.summary: Returns true if the peer is authenticated.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.AuthContext.PeerIdentityPropertyName
member.summary: Gets the name of the property that indicates the peer identity. Returns null if the peer is not authenticated.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.AuthContext.PeerIdentity
member.summary: Gets properties that represent the peer identity (there can be more than one). Returns an empty collection if the peer is not authenticated.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.AuthContext.Properties
member.summary: Gets the auth properties of this context.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.AuthContext.FindPropertiesByName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the auth properties with given name (there can be more than one). If no properties of given name exist, an empty collection will be returned.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.AuthProperty
member.summary: A property of an . Note: experimental API that can change or be removed without any prior notice.

member.summary: Gets the name of the property.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.AuthProperty.Value
member.summary: Gets the string value of the property.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.AuthProperty.ValueBytes
member.summary: Gets the binary value of the property.

member.summary: Creates an instance of AuthProperty.
member.param: the name
the binary value of the property

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.AuthProperty.ValueBytesUnsafe
member.summary: Gets the binary value of the property (without making a defensive copy).

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.AuthProperty.CreateUnsafe(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates and instance of AuthProperty without making a defensive copy of valueBytes.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.BindServiceMethodAttribute
member.summary:
Specifies the location of the service bind method for a gRPC service. The bind method is typically generated code and is used to register a service's methods with the server on startup.
The bind method signature takes a and an optional instance of the service base class, e.g. static void BindService(ServiceBinderBase, GreeterService).

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.BindServiceMethodAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The type the service bind method is defined on.
The name of the service bind method.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.BindServiceMethodAttribute.BindType
member.summary: Gets the type the service bind method is defined on.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.BindServiceMethodAttribute.BindMethodName
member.summary: Gets the name of the service bind method.

member.summary: Invokes a server streaming call asynchronously. In server streaming scenario, client sends on request and server responds with a stream of responses.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.CallInvoker.AsyncClientStreamingCall``2(Grpc.Core.Method{``0,``1},System.String,Grpc.Core.CallOptions)
member.summary: Invokes a client streaming call asynchronously. In client streaming scenario, client sends a stream of requests and server responds with a single response.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.CallInvoker.AsyncDuplexStreamingCall``2(Grpc.Core.Method{``0,``1},System.String,Grpc.Core.CallOptions)
member.summary: Invokes a duplex streaming call asynchronously. In duplex streaming scenario, client sends a stream of requests and server responds with a stream of responses. The response stream is completely independent and both side can be sending messages at the same time.

member.summary: Options for calls made by client.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of CallOptions struct.
member.param: Headers to be sent with the call.
Deadline for the call to finish. null means no deadline.
Can be used to request cancellation of the call.

Context propagation token obtained from .
Credentials to use for this call.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.CallOptions.Headers
member.summary: Headers to send at the beginning of the call.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.CallOptions.Deadline
member.summary: Call deadline.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.CallOptions.CancellationToken
member.summary: Token that can be used for cancelling the call on the client side. Cancelling the token will request cancellation of the remote call. Best effort will be made to deliver the cancellation notification to the server and interaction of the call with the server side will be terminated. Unless the call finishes before the cancellation could happen (there is an inherent race), the call will finish with StatusCode.Cancelled status.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.CallOptions.WriteOptions
member.summary: Write options that will be used for this call.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.CallOptions.PropagationToken
member.summary: Token for propagating parent call context.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.CallOptions.Credentials
member.summary: Credentials to use for this call.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.CallOptions.IsWaitForReady
member.summary: If true and and channel is in ChannelState.TransientFailure, the call will attempt waiting for the channel to recover instead of failing immediately (which is the default "FailFast" semantics). Note: experimental API that can change or be removed without any prior notice.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.CallOptions.Flags
member.summary: Flags to use for this call.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.ContextPropagationOptions
member.summary: Options for .

member.summary: The context propagation options that will be used by default.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.ContextPropagationOptions.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates new context propagation options.
member.param: If set to true parent call's deadline will be propagated to the child call.
If set to true parent call's cancellation token will be propagated to the child call.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.ContextPropagationOptions.IsPropagateDeadline
member.summary: true if parent call's deadline should be propagated to the child call.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.ContextPropagationOptions.IsPropagateCancellation
member.summary: true if parent call's cancellation token should be propagated to the child call.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.ContextPropagationToken
member.summary: Token for propagating context of server side handlers to child calls. In situations when a backend is making calls to another backend, it makes sense to propagate properties like deadline and cancellation token of the server call to the child call. Underlying gRPC implementation may provide other "opaque" contexts (like tracing context) that are not explicitly accesible via the public C# API, but this token still allows propagating them.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.DeserializationContext
member.summary: Provides access to the payload being deserialized when deserializing messages.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.DeserializationContext.PayloadLength
member.summary: Get the total length of the payload in bytes.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.DeserializationContext.PayloadAsNewBuffer
member.summary: Gets the entire payload as a newly allocated byte array. Once the byte array is returned, the byte array becomes owned by the caller and won't be ever accessed or reused by gRPC again. NOTE: Obtaining the buffer as a newly allocated byte array is the simplest way of accessing the payload, but it can have important consequences in high-performance scenarios. In particular, using this method usually requires copying of the entire buffer one extra time. Also, allocating a new buffer each time can put excessive pressure on GC, especially if the payload is more than 86700 bytes large (which means the newly allocated buffer will be placed in LOH, and LOH object can only be garbage collected via a full ("stop the world") GC run). NOTE: Deserializers are expected not to call this method (or other payload accessor methods) more than once per received message (as there is no practical reason for doing so) and DeserializationContext implementations are free to assume so.
member.returns: byte array containing the entire payload.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.IAsyncStreamReader`1
member.summary:
A stream of messages to be read. Messages can be awaited await reader.MoveNext(), that returns true if there is a message available and false if there are no more messages (i.e. the stream has been closed).
On the client side, the last invocation of MoveNext() either returns false if the call has finished successfully or throws RpcException if call finished with an error. Once the call finishes, subsequent invocations of MoveNext() will continue yielding the same result (returning false or throwing an exception).
On the server side, MoveNext() does not throw exceptions. In case of a failure, the request stream will appear to be finished (MoveNext will return false) and the CancellationToken associated with the call will be cancelled to signal the failure.
MoveNext() operations can be cancelled via a cancellation token. Cancelling an individual read operation has the same effect as cancelling the entire call (which will also result in the read operation returning prematurely), but the per-read cancellation tokens passed to MoveNext() only result in cancelling the call if the read operation haven't finished yet.
member.typeparam: The message type.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.IAsyncStreamWriter`1
member.summary: A writable stream of messages.
member.typeparam: The message type.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.IAsyncStreamWriter`1.WriteAsync(`0)
member.summary: Writes a single asynchronously. Only one write can be pending at a time.
member.param: the message to be written. Cannot be null.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.IAsyncStreamWriter`1.WriteOptions
member.summary: Write options that will be used for the next write. If null, default options will be used. Once set, this property maintains its value across subsequent writes.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.IClientStreamWriter`1
member.summary: Client-side writable stream of messages with Close capability.
member.typeparam: The message type.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.IClientStreamWriter`1.CompleteAsync
member.summary: Completes/closes the stream. Can only be called once there is no pending write. No writes should follow calling this.

member.summary: Carries along the context associated with intercepted invocations on the client side.

The host to dispatch the current call to.
A instance containing the call options of the current call.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor
member.summary: Serves as the base class for gRPC interceptors.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.BlockingUnaryCallContinuation`2
member.summary: Represents a continuation for intercepting simple blocking invocations. A delegate of this type is passed to the BlockingUnaryCall method when an outgoing invocation is being intercepted and calling the delegate will invoke the next interceptor in the chain, or the underlying call invoker if called from the last interceptor. The interceptor is allowed to call it zero, one, or multiple times, passing it the appropriate context and request values as it sees fit.
member.typeparam: Request message type for this invocation.
Response message type for this invocation.
member.param: The request value to continue the invocation with.
The instance to pass to the next step in the invocation process.
member.returns: The response value of the invocation to return to the caller. The interceptor can choose to return the return value of the continuation delegate or an arbitrary value as it sees fit.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.AsyncUnaryCallContinuation`2
member.summary: Represents a continuation for intercepting simple asynchronous invocations. A delegate of this type is passed to the AsyncUnaryCall method when an outgoing invocation is being intercepted and calling the delegate will invoke the next interceptor in the chain, or the underlying call invoker if called from the last interceptor. The interceptor is allowed to call it zero, one, or multiple times, passing it the appropriate request value and context as it sees fit.
member.typeparam: Request message type for this invocation.
Response message type for this invocation.
member.param: The request value to continue the invocation with.
The instance to pass to the next step in the invocation process.
member.returns: An instance of representing an asynchronous invocation of a unary RPC. The interceptor can choose to return the same object returned from the continuation delegate or an arbitrarily constructed instance as it sees fit.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.AsyncServerStreamingCallContinuation`2
member.summary: Represents a continuation for intercepting asynchronous server-streaming invocations. A delegate of this type is passed to the AsyncServerStreamingCall method when an outgoing invocation is being intercepted and calling the delegate will invoke the next interceptor in the chain, or the underlying call invoker if called from the last interceptor. The interceptor is allowed to call it zero, one, or multiple times, passing it the appropriate request value and context as it sees fit.
member.typeparam: Request message type for this invocation.
Response message type for this invocation.
member.param: The request value to continue the invocation with.
The instance to pass to the next step in the invocation process.
member.returns: An instance of representing an asynchronous invocation of a server-streaming RPC. The interceptor can choose to return the same object returned from the continuation delegate or an arbitrarily constructed instance as it sees fit.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.AsyncClientStreamingCallContinuation`2
member.summary: Represents a continuation for intercepting asynchronous client-streaming invocations. A delegate of this type is passed to the AsyncClientStreamingCall method when an outgoing invocation is being intercepted and calling the delegate will invoke the next interceptor in the chain, or the underlying call invoker if called from the last interceptor. The interceptor is allowed to call it zero, one, or multiple times, passing it the appropriate request value and context as it sees fit.
member.typeparam: Request message type for this invocation.
Response message type for this invocation.
member.param: The instance to pass to the next step in the invocation process.
member.returns: An instance of representing an asynchronous invocation of a client-streaming RPC. The interceptor can choose to return the same object returned from the continuation delegate or an arbitrarily constructed instance as it sees fit.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.AsyncDuplexStreamingCallContinuation`2
member.summary: Represents a continuation for intercepting asynchronous duplex invocations. A delegate of this type is passed to the AsyncDuplexStreamingCall method when an outgoing invocation is being intercepted and calling the delegate will invoke the next interceptor in the chain, or the underlying call invoker if called from the last interceptor. The interceptor is allowed to call it zero, one, or multiple times, passing it the appropriate request value and context as it sees fit.
member.param: The instance to pass to the next step in the invocation process.
member.returns: An instance of representing an asynchronous invocation of a duplex-streaming RPC. The interceptor can choose to return the same object returned from the continuation delegate or an arbitrarily constructed instance as it sees fit.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.BlockingUnaryCall``2(``0,Grpc.Core.Interceptors.ClientInterceptorContext{``0,``1},Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.BlockingUnaryCallContinuation{``0,``1})
member.summary: Intercepts a blocking invocation of a simple remote call.
member.param: The request message of the invocation.
The associated with the current invocation.

The callback that continues the invocation process. This can be invoked zero or more times by the interceptor. The interceptor can invoke the continuation passing the given request value and context arguments, or substitute them as it sees fit.
member.returns: The response message of the current invocation. The interceptor can simply return the return value of the continuation delegate passed to it intact, or an arbitrary value as it sees fit.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.AsyncUnaryCall``2(``0,Grpc.Core.Interceptors.ClientInterceptorContext{``0,``1},Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.AsyncUnaryCallContinuation{``0,``1})
member.summary: Intercepts an asynchronous invocation of a simple remote call.
member.param: The request message of the invocation.
The associated with the current invocation.

The callback that continues the invocation process. This can be invoked zero or more times by the interceptor. The interceptor can invoke the continuation passing the given request value and context arguments, or substitute them as it sees fit.
member.returns: An instance of representing an asynchronous unary invocation. The interceptor can simply return the return value of the continuation delegate passed to it intact, or construct its own substitute as it sees fit.

member.param: The request message of the invocation.
The associated with the current invocation.

The callback that continues the invocation process. This can be invoked zero or more times by the interceptor. The interceptor can invoke the continuation passing the given request value and context arguments, or substitute them as it sees fit.
member.returns: An instance of representing an asynchronous server-streaming invocation. The interceptor can simply return the return value of the continuation delegate passed to it intact, or construct its own substitute as it sees fit.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.AsyncClientStreamingCall``2(Grpc.Core.Interceptors.ClientInterceptorContext{``0,``1},Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.AsyncClientStreamingCallContinuation{``0,``1})
member.summary: Intercepts an asynchronous invocation of a client streaming call.
member.param: The associated with the current invocation.

The callback that continues the invocation process. This can be invoked zero or more times by the interceptor. The interceptor can invoke the continuation passing the given context argument, or substitute as it sees fit.
member.returns: An instance of representing an asynchronous client-streaming invocation. The interceptor can simply return the return value of the continuation delegate passed to it intact, or construct its own substitute as it sees fit.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.AsyncDuplexStreamingCall``2(Grpc.Core.Interceptors.ClientInterceptorContext{``0,``1},Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.AsyncDuplexStreamingCallContinuation{``0,``1})
member.summary: Intercepts an asynchronous invocation of a duplex streaming call.
member.param: The associated with the current invocation.

The callback that continues the invocation process. This can be invoked zero or more times by the interceptor. The interceptor can invoke the continuation passing the given context argument, or substitute as it sees fit.
member.returns: An instance of representing an asynchronous duplex-streaming invocation. The interceptor can simply return the return value of the continuation delegate passed to it intact, or construct its own substitute as it sees fit.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.UnaryServerHandler``2(``0,Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext,Grpc.Core.UnaryServerMethod{``0,``1})
member.summary: Server-side handler for intercepting and incoming unary call.
member.typeparam: Request message type for this method.
Response message type for this method.
member.param: The request value of the incoming invocation.
An instance of representing the context of the invocation.

A delegate that asynchronously proceeds with the invocation, calling the next interceptor in the chain, or the service request handler, in case of the last interceptor and return the response value of the RPC. The interceptor can choose to call it zero or more times at its discretion.
member.returns: A future representing the response value of the RPC. The interceptor can simply return the return value from the continuation intact, or an arbitrary response value as it sees fit.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.ClientStreamingServerHandler``2(Grpc.Core.IAsyncStreamReader{``0},Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext,Grpc.Core.ClientStreamingServerMethod{``0,``1})
member.summary: Server-side handler for intercepting client streaming call.
member.typeparam: Request message type for this method.
Response message type for this method.
member.param: The request stream of the incoming invocation.
An instance of representing the context of the invocation.

A delegate that asynchronously proceeds with the invocation, calling the next interceptor in the chain, or the service request handler, in case of the last interceptor and return the response value of the RPC. The interceptor can choose to call it zero or more times at its discretion.
member.returns: A future representing the response value of the RPC. The interceptor can simply return the return value from the continuation intact, or an arbitrary response value as it sees fit. The interceptor has the ability to wrap or substitute the request stream when calling the continuation.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.ServerStreamingServerHandler``2(``0,Grpc.Core.IServerStreamWriter{``1},Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext,Grpc.Core.ServerStreamingServerMethod{``0,``1})
member.summary: Server-side handler for intercepting server streaming call.
member.typeparam: Request message type for this method.
Response message type for this method.
member.param: The request value of the incoming invocation.
The response stream of the incoming invocation.
An instance of representing the context of the invocation.

A delegate that asynchronously proceeds with the invocation, calling the next interceptor in the chain, or the service request handler, in case of the last interceptor and the interceptor can choose to call it zero or more times at its discretion. The interceptor has the ability to wrap or substitute the request value and the response stream when calling the continuation.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Interceptors.Interceptor.DuplexStreamingServerHandler``2(Grpc.Core.IAsyncStreamReader{``0},Grpc.Core.IServerStreamWriter{``1},Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext,Grpc.Core.DuplexStreamingServerMethod{``0,``1})
member.summary: Server-side handler for intercepting bidirectional streaming calls.
member.typeparam: Request message type for this method.
Response message type for this method.
member.param: The request stream of the incoming invocation.
The response stream of the incoming invocation.
An instance of representing the context of the invocation.

A delegate that asynchronously proceeds with the invocation, calling the next interceptor in the chain, or the service request handler, in case of the last interceptor and the interceptor can choose to call it zero or more times at its discretion. The interceptor has the ability to wrap or substitute the request and response streams when calling the continuation.

member.summary: A writable stream of messages that is used in server-side handlers.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Marshaller`1.#ctor(System.Action{`0,Grpc.Core.SerializationContext},System.Func{Grpc.Core.DeserializationContext,`0})
member.summary: Initializes a new marshaller from serialize/deserialize fuctions that can access serialization and deserialization context. Compared to the simple serializer/deserializer functions, using the contextual version provides more flexibility and can lead to increased efficiency (and better performance). Note: This constructor is part of an experimental API that can change or be removed without any prior notice.
member.param: Function that will be used to serialize messages.
Function that will be used to deserialize messages.

member.summary: Gets the serializer function.

member.summary: Gets the deserializer function.

member.summary: Gets the serializer function. Note: experimental API that can change or be removed without any prior notice.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.Marshaller`1.ContextualDeserializer
member.summary: Gets the serializer function. Note: experimental API that can change or be removed without any prior notice.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.Marshallers.StringMarshaller
member.summary: Returns a marshaller for string type. This is useful for testing.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.Metadata
member.summary:
A collection of metadata entries that can be exchanged during a call. gRPC supports these types of metadata:
Request headersare sent by the client at the beginning of a remote call before any request messages are sent.
Response headersare sent by the server at the beginning of a remote call handler before any response messages are sent.
Response trailersare sent by the server at the end of a remote call along with resulting call status.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.Metadata.BinaryHeaderSuffix
member.summary: All binary headers should have this suffix.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Empty
member.summary: An read-only instance of metadata containing no entries.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.Metadata.CompressionRequestAlgorithmMetadataKey
member.summary: To be used in initial metadata to request specific compression algorithm for given call. Direct selection of compression algorithms is an internal feature and is not part of public API.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Metadata.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of Metadata.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Freeze
member.summary: Makes this object read-only.
member.returns: this object

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Add(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new ASCII-valued metadata entry. See Metadata.Entry constructor for params.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Add(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Adds a new binary-valued metadata entry. See Metadata.Entry constructor for params.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Entry
member.summary: Metadata entry

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Entry.#ctor(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct with a binary value.
member.param: Metadata key. Gets converted to lowercase. Needs to have suffix indicating a binary valued metadata entry. Can only contain lowercase alphanumeric characters, underscores, hyphens and dots.
Value bytes.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Entry.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct with an ASCII value.
member.param: Metadata key. Gets converted to lowercase. Must not use suffix indicating a binary valued metadata entry. Can only contain lowercase alphanumeric characters, underscores, hyphens and dots.
Value string. Only ASCII characters are allowed.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Entry.Key
member.summary: Gets the metadata entry key.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Entry.ValueBytes
member.summary: Gets the binary value of this metadata entry.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Entry.Value
member.summary: Gets the string value of this metadata entry.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Entry.IsBinary
member.summary: Returns true if this entry is a binary-value entry.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Entry.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents the current .

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Entry.GetSerializedValueUnsafe
member.summary: Gets the serialized value for this entry. For binary metadata entries, this leaks the internal valueBytes byte array and caller must not change contents of it.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Entry.CreateUnsafe(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a binary value or ascii value metadata entry from data received from the native layer. We trust C core to give us well-formed data, so we don't perform any checks or defensive copying.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Metadata.Entry.HasBinaryHeaderSuffix(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the key has "-bin" binary header suffix.

member.summary: Single request sent from client, single response received from server.

member.summary: Stream of request sent from client, single response received from server.

member.summary: Single request sent from client, stream of responses received from server.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.MethodType.DuplexStreaming
member.summary: Both server and client can stream arbitrary number of requests and responses simultaneously.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.RpcException
member.summary: Thrown when remote procedure call fails. Every RpcException is associated with a resulting of the call.

member.summary: Creates a new RpcException associated with given status.
member.param: Resulting status of a call.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.RpcException.#ctor(Grpc.Core.Status,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new RpcException associated with given status and message.
member.param: Resulting status of a call.
The exception message.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.RpcException.#ctor(Grpc.Core.Status,Grpc.Core.Metadata)
member.summary: Creates a new RpcException associated with given status and trailing response metadata.
member.param: Resulting status of a call.
Response trailing metadata.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.RpcException.#ctor(Grpc.Core.Status,Grpc.Core.Metadata,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new RpcException associated with given status, message and trailing response metadata.
member.param: Resulting status of a call.
Response trailing metadata.
The exception message.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.RpcException.Status
member.summary: Resulting status of the call.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.RpcException.StatusCode
member.summary: Returns the status code of the call, as a convenient alternative to Status.StatusCode.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.RpcException.Trailers
member.summary: Gets the call trailing metadata. Trailers only have meaningful content for client-side calls (in which case they represent the trailing metadata sent by the server when closing the call). Instances of RpcException thrown by the server-side part of the stack will have trailers always set to empty.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.SerializationContext
member.summary: Provides storage for payload when serializing a message.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.SerializationContext.Complete(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Use the byte array as serialized form of current message and mark serialization process as complete. Complete() can only be called once. By calling this method the caller gives up the ownership of the payload which must not be accessed afterwards.
member.param: the serialized form of current message

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext
member.summary: Context for a server-side call.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of ServerCallContext.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext.WriteResponseHeadersAsync(Grpc.Core.Metadata)
member.summary: Asynchronously sends response headers for the current call to the client. This method may only be invoked once for each call and needs to be invoked before any response messages are written. Writing the first response message implicitly sends empty response headers if WriteResponseHeadersAsync haven't been called yet.
member.param: The response headers to send.
member.returns: The task that finished once response headers have been written.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext.CreatePropagationToken(Grpc.Core.ContextPropagationOptions)
member.summary: Creates a propagation token to be used to propagate call context to a child call.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext.Method
member.summary: Name of method called in this RPC.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext.Host
member.summary: Name of host called in this RPC.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext.Peer
member.summary: Address of the remote endpoint in URI format.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext.RequestHeaders
member.summary: Initial metadata sent by client.

member.summary: Cancellation token signals when call is cancelled.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext.ResponseTrailers
member.summary: Trailers to send back to client after RPC finishes.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext.Status
member.summary: Status to send back to client after RPC finishes.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext.WriteOptions
member.summary: Allows setting write options for the following write. For streaming response calls, this property is also exposed as on IServerStreamWriter for convenience. Both properties are backed by the same underlying value.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext.AuthContext
member.summary: Gets the AuthContext associated with this call. Note: Access to AuthContext is an experimental API that can change without any prior notice.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext.UserState
member.summary: Gets a dictionary that can be used by the various interceptors and handlers of this call to store arbitrary state.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.Status.StatusCode

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.Status.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents the current .

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.StatusCode
member.summary: Result of a remote procedure call. Based on grpc_status_code from grpc/status.h

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.OK
member.summary: Not an error; returned on success.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.Cancelled
member.summary: The operation was cancelled (typically by the caller).

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown error. An example of where this error may be returned is if a Status value received from another address space belongs to an error-space that is not known in this address space. Also errors raised by APIs that do not return enough error information may be converted to this error.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.InvalidArgument
member.summary: Client specified an invalid argument. Note that this differs from FAILED_PRECONDITION. INVALID_ARGUMENT indicates arguments that are problematic regardless of the state of the system (e.g., a malformed file name).

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.DeadlineExceeded
member.summary: Deadline expired before operation could complete. For operations that change the state of the system, this error may be returned even if the operation has completed successfully. For example, a successful response from a server could have been delayed long enough for the deadline to expire.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.NotFound
member.summary: Some requested entity (e.g., file or directory) was not found.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.AlreadyExists
member.summary: Some entity that we attempted to create (e.g., file or directory) already exists.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.PermissionDenied
member.summary: The caller does not have permission to execute the specified operation. PERMISSION_DENIED must not be used for rejections caused by exhausting some resource (use RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED instead for those errors). PERMISSION_DENIED must not be used if the caller can not be identified (use UNAUTHENTICATED instead for those errors).

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.Unauthenticated
member.summary: The request does not have valid authentication credentials for the operation.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.ResourceExhausted
member.summary: Some resource has been exhausted, perhaps a per-user quota, or perhaps the entire file system is out of space.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.FailedPrecondition
member.summary: Operation was rejected because the system is not in a state required for the operation's execution. For example, directory to be deleted may be non-empty, an rmdir operation is applied to a non-directory, etc.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.Aborted
member.summary: The operation was aborted, typically due to a concurrency issue like sequencer check failures, transaction aborts, etc.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.OutOfRange
member.summary: Operation was attempted past the valid range. E.g., seeking or reading past end of file.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.Unimplemented
member.summary: Operation is not implemented or not supported/enabled in this service.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.Internal
member.summary: Internal errors. Means some invariants expected by underlying system has been broken. If you see one of these errors, something is very broken.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.Unavailable
member.summary: The service is currently unavailable. This is a most likely a transient condition and may be corrected by retrying with a backoff. Note that it is not always safe to retry non-idempotent operations.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.StatusCode.DataLoss
member.summary: Unrecoverable data loss or corruption.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.Utils.GrpcPreconditions
member.summary: Utility methods to simplify checking preconditions in the code.

The error message.

The parameter name.

member.summary: Throws if condition is false.
member.param: The condition.

member.summary: Throws with given message if condition is false.
member.param: The condition.
The error message.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.VersionInfo
member.summary: Provides info about current version of gRPC. See https://codingforsmarties.wordpress.com/2016/01/21/how-to-version-assemblies-destined-for-nuget/ for rationale about assembly versioning.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.VersionInfo.CurrentAssemblyVersion
member.summary: Current AssemblyVersion attribute of gRPC C# assemblies

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.VersionInfo.CurrentAssemblyFileVersion
member.summary: Current AssemblyFileVersion of gRPC C# assemblies

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.VersionInfo.CurrentVersion
member.summary: Current version of gRPC C#

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.WriteFlags
member.summary: Flags for write operations.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.WriteFlags.BufferHint
member.summary: Hint that the write may be buffered and need not go out on the wire immediately. gRPC is free to buffer the message until the next non-buffered write, or until write stream completion, but it need not buffer completely or at all.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.WriteFlags.NoCompress
member.summary: Force compression to be disabled for a particular write.

member.name: T:Grpc.Core.WriteOptions
member.summary: Options for write operations.

member.name: F:Grpc.Core.WriteOptions.Default
member.summary: Default write options.

member.name: M:Grpc.Core.WriteOptions.#ctor(Grpc.Core.WriteFlags)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of WriteOptions class.
member.param: The write flags.

member.name: P:Grpc.Core.WriteOptions.Flags
member.summary: Gets the write flags.
